extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 (4-5 ounce each) thinly sliced chicken breasts or cutlets

recipes.title: Chicken Milanese with Lemon Butter Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken works really well with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. One wine you could try is CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi. It has 4.1 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: CalNaturale Chardonnay Lodi
productMatches.description: Complexity and intensity define this Chardonnay. The nose is full of citrus, green apple and pear with floral overtones. The flavors are rich on entry with lively fruit in the mid palate and a long fruity, warm finish.

recipes.instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large, deep skillet or braiser or medium-high heat.Add flour to a shallow dish or large plate.In another shallow bowl beat egg with minced garlic.Place bread crumbs in another shallow dish or large plate.Season both sides of chicken with lemon pepper seasoning and a pinch of salt.Dredge chicken in flour then dip in egg allowing excess egg to drip off then dip into breadcrumbs generously coating both sides of chicken.Repeat process until each piece of chicken is coated.Once oil is hot, place 2 or 3 pieces of chicken in skillet cooking for about 3-4 minutes until golden brown. Carefully turn chicken and cook for another 3-4 minutes until thoroughly cooked and golden brown.Transfer cooked chicken to a paper towel lined plate.Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.Add wine, lemon zest and juice and bring to a low boil.Reduce to a simmer and cook for about 3-4 minutes longer.Drizzle sauce over chicken before serving.

steps.step: Heat vegetable oil in a large, deep skillet or braiser or medium-high heat.
Add flour to a shallow dish or large plate.In another shallow bowl beat egg with minced garlic.

Place bread crumbs in another shallow dish or large plate.Season both sides of chicken with lemon pepper seasoning and a pinch of salt.Dredge chicken in flour then dip in egg allowing excess egg to drip off then dip into breadcrumbs generously coating both sides of chicken.Repeat process until each piece of chicken is coated.Once oil is hot, place 2 or 3 pieces of chicken in skillet cooking for about 3-4 minutes until golden brown. Carefully turn chicken and cook for another 3-4 minutes until thoroughly cooked and golden brown.
Transfer cooked chicken to a paper towel lined plate.Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add wine, lemon zest and juice and bring to a low boil.Reduce to a simmer and cook for about 3-4 minutes longer.
Drizzle sauce over chicken before serving.
